intro: Syngonanthus anthemidiflorus, commonly known as the yellow starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small stars. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Syngonanthus anthemidiflorus is often found in wetlands and along the edges of swamps, where it plays a role in maintaining local biodiversity.
